overview_of_class: The Magazine Writing Lab is a hands-on introduction to the core competencies of magazine writing, basic editing, and story packaging/producing for short-form works. This course will introduce you to the basics of "magazine think," the process by which magazine writers and editors pitch, assign, write, edit and eventually publish magazine journalism in a host of formats for publications in a print/digital/social world. Throughout the quarter, we will focus on the building blocks of magazines?audience, voice, story framing, magazine architecture, editorial judgment, narrative structure, curation and aggregation, and all-important short-form story treatments to create magazine-style pieces, both in print and multimedia, for publication. Ultimately, the course arms students with the skills necessarily to create multi-platform, magazine-style stories throughout the quarter for possible publication on the Medill Reports website.

overview_of_class: The News Reporting experience is built around two days a week?in the Medill Content Lab, focused on giving you a practical, hands-on, immersive grounding in reporting, storytelling and digital production in the fast-paced, multiplatform, always-on news cycle of today. Our goal is to help you become a more seasoned, savvy, multi-dimensional and fleet-footed journalist and beat reporter. ?Working closely with a faculty member as your primary editor, you will focus on finding, cultivating and interviewing sources on a beat; cover breaking and enterprise stories on and off that beat; publish to myriad platforms; and occasionally work in teams. One of the main objectives is to give you experience in the rigors, realities and risks of the constant news cycle that is the norm today.

overview_of_class: This class will give you hands-on experience covering the nation's capital as a real-time journalist on a beat, producing up-to-the-minute political stories for the Medill on the Hill website. The primary focus of the course, instant newsgathering and multi-media reporting, will enhance innovative story-telling and deadline skills. The course will teach you not only how to report about federal policy and politics, but how to do so for an audience of young people.
